page.title: 12THE RIVER WYE _ FISHING
page.content: Today, much of the{River Wye}is owned privately. The owners can hire out or sell their property. Sometimes they have to pay rates of up to{Â£400} according to the number of fish caught in a year. The main types of fish{ {trout, salmon}and{coarse fish}(chub, dace,grayling and char). People no longer keep trout in the river in large numbers but instead they use trout ponds.{Salmon}is still the main game fish of the river despite its fall in numbers. this fall is partly due to the number of game fish which eat salmon eggs and{poaching}is also a problem. Also when the salmon leave the river to go to their feeding grounds many of them are caught by netsmen.
